Another great option is "Wrong Turn", which offers a thrilling tale of a group of friends lost in the woods and hunted by inbred cannibals - perfect for fans of edge-of-your-seat horror! Enjoy the chills!

Based on your interest in war films and a plot that involves things going wrong earlier, I'd highly recommend "Apocalypse Now" (1979). This movie follows a U.S. Army officer in Vietnam tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel. The powerful performances by Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando, and Robert Duvall really make it stand out.

If you're up for something more action-packed, "Inglourious Basterds" (2009) is another great choice. Directed by Quentin Tarantino, this film features an ensemble cast led by Brad Pitt, and tells the story of a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers planning to assassinate Nazi leaders during World War II. Enjoy!

Alternatively, if you're more into epic tales with a diverse ensemble of stars, "The Odyssey" might be an exciting choice for you.
